title: Updating Mental Models
content: Your mental model must evolve as new information arrives. When what you perceive contradicts your model, you face a choice: update the model or reject the information. Confirmation bias pushes you toward rejecting contradictory data. Fight this tendency. If reality doesn't match your model, your model is probably wrong.

mcq.question: You expect a valve to be closed based on the procedure. You check it and it appears closed. Later, you discover it was actually open. What mental model error occurred?

options.B: Expectation bias caused you to see what you expected rather than what was actually there
options.D: Someone opened it after you checked

mcq.explanation: Expectation bias is a comprehension error. Your mental model said 'valve is closed,' so you perceived confirmation of that model rather than carefully evaluating actual position.

openQuestions: How do you know when to trust your mental model versus when to question it?
